excerpt.en: IRAP application for Fey, an intelligent journal for self-directed investors. Submitted by Narative.

content.value: 1. Management Team and Skill Set

Narative is a digital product studio that designs, engineers and markets products in partnership with select clients, alongside incubating products internally that we feel strongly suited to bring to market ourselves.
The Narative team is comprised solely of senior-level talent, possessing all of the necessarily skills and experience to successfully build and grow technology products to scale.
Dennis Brotzky, Engineering
Previously: Lead engineer at Grow Technologies (Fintech)
Dan Le Van, Engineering
Previously: Senior engineer at Hopper (Technology)
Thiago Costa, Design & Engineering
Previously: Director of design at Breather (Real Estate / Technology)
Thomas Russell, Product
Previously: Founder, 13 Software Solutions (Fintech)
Mack Mansouri, Project Management
Previously: Lead Innovation at Planbox and Lightspeed POS (Technology)
Brad Tiller, Marketing
Previously: Senior Content Specialist at Lightspeed and Unbounce (Technology)
Management expertise routed in finance and technology
Track record building and marketing large-scale products
Combination of entrepreneurial and senior-level backgrounds
Experience driving product through the entire business lifecycle of development, commercialization, scale and acquisition
Marketing and branding expertise vital for positioning and market share
Access to an established community, allowing for low-cost, targeted customer acquisition
2. Financial Capability
1st Financial Year Revenue: $625,000 generated via Studio
Typical contract size is around $450,000
Clients continue to fund Studio
3. Technology Overview
Live charts and Chrome extension

No more copy and pasting screenshots — Fey’s Chrome extension allows traders to create new journal entries using live charts and data from platforms like Trading View, AlphaVantage, Yahoo Finance and Intrinio.
Fallback:

When capturing live charts Fey takes static screenshots in case we’re unable to effectively reproduce the live chart data. In case live charts don’t render we gracefully degrade to static images. 

The extension is in place to enhance the Fey experience, but is not required — Fey is designed to function completely without the need for an extension.
Report uploads
Upload custom reports from your investment broker and Fey will automatically reconcile any data — such as balances, deposits, open positions and current journal items — with any existing entries.
Fallback:

Broker sync is used to replace manual report uploads. If broker sync is unavailable, it’s possible to build your own data in Fey but insights will be reduced. We have begun creating a tool that randomly generates variations of CSV reports so we can ensure our parser is able to handle any structure a broker provides.
Live broker sync

Eliminate manual data entry entirely by connecting Fey directly with your investment broker, syncing every single position in real-time. No trading platform has ever offered this level of integration.
Fallback:

FXCM’s WebSocket has been unreliable or requires multiple connections per user. In this case, we're closing all sockets and auto-retrying with a single socket connection. If the broker API goes down, we have manually uploaded reports or notify the user to upload manually.
Insights algorithm
Fey’s proprietary algorithm analyzes all of your positions — whether they’re
live positions
or saved as
ideas
— to identify patterns and give feedback that helps investors better understand their own behaviour.
Fallback:

We must design a system that can handle missing data sources or incomplete data. If we have user data and no broker data we must still be able to give insights. This is a complementary feature to Fey’s core journaling aspect.
Sharing and collaboration

Self-directed investors trade independently, but the community works together to identify ideal trading tactics and opportunities. Fey makes it easy to share your live positions and ideas with others, while protecting any sensitive info.
Fallback:
If there is an inability to sync via WebSockets for multiple users, we'd fall back to a delayed collaboration system with a REST API.
4. Market Opportunity
Potential customer
Self directed investment accounts in North America and Europe
Aged 18 and over
Investing in any major asset class: Stocks, Bonds, Commodities, Currencies and popular ETF's / CFD's
The Problem
Interest in investing has more than doubled in the past 3 years, thanks to reduced fees and ease of access driven by web and mobile technology
For those investing regularly, the necessary tools to build an effective investment workflow have become fragmented and outdated
Today's investors are using generic note taking tools such as Evernote to store their detail-rich research including charts, notes, snippets and annual reports
This is managed alongside bulky Excel or Google sheets that manually record research and performance data
These spreadsheets are incredibly difficult to maintain and very often inaccurate
A gap exists between this data and the user's real life execution, they must manually report back their performance, much like the old digital banking ecosystem before
Mint
A user has multiple investment accounts, similar to savings, with various balances, assets and reports to monitor
All of this before they even get to the risk that is investing their own money and making considered, unemotional decisions
Perhaps worst of all, they're entirely dependent on themselves for feedback
Surveying Fey early access signups, 97% of respondents described using this exact workflow
We also find those who lack a trading journal entirely to be intimidated by its complexity, meaning a gross loss of investing data, akin to running a business without accounts
Nothing is designed to fully serve the self-directed investor in today's market
There is an opportunity to be the Quickbooks of investing – to create a drastic process improvement
Market size and opportunity
25m active brokerage accounts in the U.S alone
$200 Billion of funds in Robo advisors (Wealthsimple etc)
$3 Trillion of funds in Self directed accounts
Niche market share

Attracting 1% of accounts from the smallest niche broker in the U.S 
>9k users and $4.4 million ARR
Mid market share

Attracting 1% of accounts from the fastest growing – stock only – broker in the U.S
>60k users and $29 million ARR
Large market share

Attracting 1% of accounts from the largest US broker
>115k users and $55 million ARR
These numbers are set to increase dramatically for the top players who value product design and innovation
Robinhood has added 1.5 million accounts per year for the past 2 years (note, these are lagging numbers as Robinhood is a privately controlled corp)
E-Trade added 135k new accounts in Q1 2019, up 41% YOY (data from public filing)
We are seeing growth in the smaller players slow as they struggle to keep up with emerging technologies, likely caused by an abundance of process and difficulty attracting talent
This makes these legacy – but still cash rich – players prime for M&A activity
Why now?
Timing:
accelerating awareness and interest in self-directed investing
Team:
scarce skillset to design develop and monetize such a complex platform
Community:
early adopters, rapid iteration, evangelizing our product among peers
Workflow:
highly sticky, integrating into the users work stack, more durable than just data collection
Technological advancements:
access to market data feeds and user ownership over broker and banking data, previously impossible to access without significant cost
Business model
SAAS model
$29 USD per month ($40 CAD) as a base price
B2B distribution, brokers, education providers, universities
Acquisition strategy
Early adopter community
Request access and refer peers
Shareable links to your investment thesis
Broker integration means exposure to app store
Targeted press outreach to those who've requested our solution

Phases of market share:
2020: First platform, focus on niche investors
2021: Expand into multi asset classes and research workflows
2022: Scale unlocks B2B opportunities i.e "seats" for Brokers
Challenges and mitigation strategies
Broker relationships
Brokers are the liquidity providers for our users, providing the necessary bridge to public markets
We must work around legacy technology to tap into targeted niche markets of early adopters
The fastest-growing players pose less risk due to existing bridge services we can pay to leverage
The relationship with legacy incumbents must be managed and maintained carefully
Our product represents an opportunity for improved unit economics, specifically an increase in LTV and client trading volume for brokers
Gaining user trust and brand recognition
The finance industry is trust driven
We must establish our brand and communicate carefully
Creating awareness around token technologies and "no password needed"
Product design and innovation will be key, as suggested by the differential in brokerage account growth rates
5. Project Phases
Phase 1:
Journaling environment with Chrome Extension
4-6 weeks
Milestones
Add charts, rich text and reports to journal canvas
Integration of live charts with market data
Chrome extension functioning across various sites
Projected cost: $49,000
Phase 2:
Broker integration, sync and execution with FXCM
4-6 weeks
Milestones
Sync journal activity and real world performance via report upload
Sync and execution with Broker via Rest API
Robust reconciliation between broker and user data
Projected cost: $49,000
Phase 3:
Insights algorithm
8-10 weeks
Milestones
Database of popular assets with OHLC values and 5 years of history
Successful creation of 10 rules based investment insight triggers
Successful trend recognition from 50 reports, with correct firing of insight triggers
Projected cost: $98,000
Phase 4:
Beta testing
Phase 5:
Commercialization
Phase 6:
Feedback and review
Phase 7:
Multi broker support
Phase 8:
Collaboration and sharing

text.en: Can you cover the 50% in labour and subcontractor expenditures as well as any other expenditure not covered by IRAP (such as 100% of capital expenditures)?
Company overview
Why are you the right team to see this project to completion and through commercial success?
High level overview of the technology or product that you are proposing to develop. Potential roadblocks and mitigating strategies.
This is very important and you should be able to describe the following:
Problem you are addressing (Potential financial gain (pricing, etc.); Market size and location; Market penetration).
Detail phases, if more than one.
